basics.name: Austin Chong
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2023.

courses: ICS 111 - Introduction to Computer Science I
ICS 211 - Introduction to Computer Science II

work.summary: Mortuary Affairs Specialists are responsible for recovery, collection, evacuation and establishment of tentative identification of each fallen member of the Department of Defense. They also inventory, contain, and evacuate personal effects of deceased DoD personnel.

awards.title: Cadet of the Month
awards.awarder: Air Force Reserve Officer Training Corps Detachment 175, University of Hawaii at Manoa
awards.summary: This award is given to the the best performing Cadet for the month.

awards.title: Giving Tree Scholarship
awards.awarder: Air Force Reserve Officer Training Corps Detachment 175, University of Hawaii at Manoa
awards.summary: This award is given to the the cadets who have participated in many volunteering events in and outside of the AFROTC Program.

awards.title: The Military Order of the World Wars Award of Merit
awards.awarder: Air Force Reserve Officer Training Corps Detachment 175, University of Hawaii at Manoa
awards.summary: This award is is presented to one member of the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th class for each branch of service for their diligence, demonstrated military excellence and outstanding accomplishments during the year.

awards.title: Army Achievement Medal
awards.summary: This award was presented to soldiers of the 962nd Quartermaster Company for outstanding leadership and devotion in support of Operation Spartan Shield.

awards.title: Armed Forces Reserve Medal with M Device
awards.summary: The AFRM with M Device is awarded to Soldiers who are involuntarily mobilized, or who voluntarily mobilize in support of specific U.S. military operations or contingencies designated by the Secretary of Defense.

awards.title: Global War on Terrorism Expeditionary Medal
awards.summary: Awarded to members of the Armed Forces of the United States who deployed abroad for service in the GWOT Operations on or after 11 September, 2001.

awards.title: Global War on Terrorism Service Medal
awards.summary: Awarded to members who have served on active duty during a designated anti-terrorism operation for a minimum 30 consecutive or 60 non-consecutive days.

awards.title: Army Service Ribbon
awards.summary: Awarded to all members of the Regular (Active) Army, and Army National Guard and United States Army Reserve in an active reserve status, for successful completion of initial-entry training.

awards.title: National Defense Service Medal
awards.summary: Awarded to every member of the US Armed Forces who have served during any one of four specified periods of armed conflict or national emergency from 1950 to the present.
